title: St Roch's F.C.
text:
St Roch's Football Club is a <a href="Scotland">Scottish</a> <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> club, based in Royston Road, <a href="Glasgow">Glasgow</a>. Nicknamed "the Candy Rock", they were formed in 1920 and play at James McGrory Park. They currently compete in the . They wear green and white strips.
St Roch's was the first club of <a href="Jimmy%20McGrory">Jimmy McGrory</a>, the British record goalscorer with 550 goals. McGrory, who grew up in the <a href="Garngad">Garngad</a> area where the club originated, began playing for them aged just 11. After helping the club win the <a href="Scottish%20Junior%20Cup">Scottish Junior Cup</a> in 1922, scoring in the final, he joined <a href="Celtic%20F.C.">Celtic</a> the following season.
Stadium.
St Roch's play at James McGrory Park on Royston Road. Originally called Provanmill Park, the ground was renamed in honour of Jimmy McGrory in 2013.
